editorialSummary.text: Performing-arts center showcasing a variety of productions, from musicals to children's theater.

originalText.text: This place is an example of how public schools can be horrible. The staff are obviously aren’t paid enough to care and I’ve had much better experiences at other community colleges in other major cities. The stem is probably the worst as the classes are a joke in how easy they are and they do not prepare you at all. It’s really sad to see. I was fortunate because I was able to afford private tutoring to make up for what was supposed to be taught here. It’s much better to enroll in a community college else where even if it means only taking online classes. It makes me resent education and that’s probably the worst part. I feel like this is my punishment for being too stupid to have not gone to a proper college right out of high school on a scholarship. Now I’m paying the price. But bunker hill in Massachusetts is so much better. Even some in new jersey they say have much better staff and educational standards. The physics teacher is good though, however even he admitted that this place was not great and that they were trying their best. Avoid this place, there are much better options! Note: some of the staff are very helpful and compassionate but they have their hands tied due to how large the school is. They truly are the unsung heroes, they looked at me pitiful eyes when I complained and that’s when I stopped having expectations from this place. In a way it was good because it made me more desperate to get out of here as soon as possible and it made me appreciate how good some of the other Public colleges were.

originalText.text:
I'VE SEEN MORE CHEER IN A GRAVEYARD!

The staff were rude and unhelpful.

If you are considering this college for yourself or one of your children, decide for yourself by going in person.  Feel free to read on about my experience.

Here were my several encounters:

1) Advisement, by 2 staff advisors
2) Health office, to update vaccine records
3) Registration area for assistance
4) security desk & janitor

1) Both advisors showed no interest in me or what I was looking for.  They acted impatient when I didn't understand the details and behaved as if I was annoying them with my questions.  It felt as if they just wanted me to go home.  I felt uncomfortable.
2) The lady in the health office repeatedly interrupted me, was extremely disrespectful, loud, and was unprofessional towards me.
3)The lady in registration area behaved as #1 above, and then was kinder after I asked for assistance from her supervisor.  Go figure.
4) Strangely enough the security staff and brief encounter with the janitor was in contrast very pleasant!  They were more polite than most of the staff.

originalText.text:
I was a student from 1994 to 1998
Quality of education: BMCC offers a wide range of academic programs that are taught by knowledgeable and experienced professors. The curriculum is challenging and prepares students for success in their chosen fields.

Accessibility: BMCC is located in the heart of New York City, making it easily accessible by public transportation. The college also offers flexible scheduling options, including evening and weekend classes, to accommodate students' busy schedules.

I was a student from 1994 to 1998
Quality of education: BMCC offers a wide range of academic programs that are taught by knowledgeable and experienced professors. The curriculum is challenging and prepares students for success in their chosen fields.

Accessibility: BMCC is located in the heart of New York City, making it easily accessible by public transportation. The college also offers flexible scheduling options, including evening and weekend classes, to accommodate students' busy schedules.

originalText.text: If you need a community college that is inclusive and resourceful for its students, staff, and nonstaff you are welcome. Good location and exceptional students get the help they need as well.

text.text: If you need a community college that is inclusive and resourceful for its students, staff, and nonstaff you are welcome. Good location and exceptional students get the help they need as well.

originalText.text:
The college has won multiple awards from the CUNY system as well as other institutions for its ability to grant Associate's Degrees at an impressive rate and to foster continuing education at senior colleges. With a respectable teacher-to-student ratio, significant public and private funding, and a central location in New York City, the learning experience has been covered by many publications and studied by experts.

However, BMCC also suffers from a large rise in remedial education, lack of freshman retention, and overcrowding. Due to its larger base of capital compared to most other two-year colleges, expansion of new campuses during the rebuilding of Fiterman Hall was possible. Several trailers are still used as classrooms to this day in order to help expand capacity. Internal programs have also been created or expanded to help with academic advisement, provide online access for registration, transferring to other colleges, and job placement.

A diverse student base, some of whom had immigrated to America shortly before enrolling, also makes tailoring a viable solution difficult. Improving the retention and graduation rate as well as the increased financial and academic burdens of a remedial program still remain a considerable problem.

The Center for Career Development (CCD) provides students with comprehensive career planning services. Its professional career counselors assist students in making informed decisions about an area of study; research occupations that match their personal interests; write a resume; practice interviewing, and help them prepare as candidates for internships and employment. Students also learn to clarify their career goals, develop effective communication and interpersonal skills, conduct job searches, and develop a digital portfolio for employers to view as evidence of their skills, accomplishments and professional qualifications. In addition, CCD partners with New York Needs You, the New York office of America Needs You, to host career-oriented events and seminars to bring industry insights to its students.
